file_content.text: They got some nice equipment in Network Access. Keep your eye out for choice stuff. Hey, treat yourself!
Anuli? We good?
Everything looks legit. Beautiful work. Zee's code is like music.
Yeah, yeah, whatever. Isolate the ones we'll need and hand the pad back to our hunter friend.
Eidolon Security's transceiver codes are marked. Easy to spot. They'll disable the encryption programs. No problem.
Why did I need these codes again?
Let's go over this again.
If you say so.
They're gonna get you access to all of Eidolon Security's confidential files.
Once we got those, the Eidolon's personal business will be everybody's business. Eat that, you ganks! Ha!
If this doesn't work....
Anuli's got a nose for this sorta thing. You'll be fine. And if he's wrong, I'll let you kill him.
Hey! That's not funny!
Relax! Rela--hey, I'm kidding! That little worm's too valuable.
Okay, so on to phase two of our plan to scrag Eidolon Security's rep and drive their clients away. Anuli?
Gotta access Eidolon Security's data transceivers. Input Zee's codes. Then slice into Eidolon's network. Download their files.
Here's a HoloNet transmitter. Once you've accessed Eidolon's network, put this on the transceiver. It'll let Anuli upload the files straight to the HoloNet.
Eidolon Security's entire database is on the HoloNet. That's bad. Real bad. For them.
The transceivers are in the Network Access Sector. Security's gonna be tight.
And the Eidolon will have his best men protecting those transceivers. Feel free to kill as many as you want.
I'm back. With Zee's codes.
Ha! Wish I could've seen the look on Zee's face.
Once you get the security codes, feel free to dispose of Zee. Never liked that Bith.
One of Eidolon Security's slogans is: "Your secrets are our secrets." So what if you were to make all those confidential records public?
It has potential.
Keep going.
Potential? You franging kidding me?
How does that hurt them?
I don't get it.
Does it involve a lot of killing?
I like my plans violent.
Does it ever! Getting access to Eidolon Security's files is gonna be harder than declawing a starving rancor!
Just picture it: every contract, every shady deal, all the security specs of every single one of the Eidolon's clients at anyone's disposal.
Hey, Anuli, what do I pay you for? How do we put Eidolon Security's records on the HoloNet?
That's real hard. Eidolon's HoloNet transceivers are in the Network Access Sector, heavily guarded. You gotta slice into those to get their records.
But gotta get past Zee's encryption programs first. You need Zee's codes--from him. Also a top-notch slicer to access Eidolon's network.
Zee's a Bith engineer. Best HoloNet security expert money can buy. He won't just give you those codes.
Where do I find Zee?
Just tell me where.
I can be very persuasive.
He will.
I've seen that firsthand, friend. I'd give you whatever you wanted.
He refuses, he dies.
Or I kill him, whichever.
A hunter after my own heart! Listen, if some gank won't help you, he's bantha fodder!
Zee's currently consulting for a Republic company called Nebula Communications.
I'd suggest you blast your way into Nebula's corporate office in the Industrial Sector, grab some security slug, force him to tell you where Zee's at.
So, everything taken care of? No more problems? Good, good.
My people are looking for signs the Eidolon is on the move. So far, it's quiet. I think he's watching.
Not the sort of behavior I was hoping for.
That's bad.
Not if you want to meet him anytime soon. And I want that very much.
Maybe we didn't hurt Eidolon Security enough.
We need to do more damage.
Now that part's easy enough to fix. Ha!
Time to do something about that.
Let's shake him up.
You took the words right out of my mouth, friend. Ha!
See, if I get rid of the Eidolon, the Cartel makes me a full-fledged boss with my own clan.
And all we gotta do is take out one little assassin and his pet corporation. What a franging deal, huh?
Mako said the hunter will take me away from here. I help find the Eidolon. I get off Nar Shaddaa. Mako said so.
If that's the deal Mako made, I'll honor it.
Done.
Mako said that, huh?
She did?
I just said I'd talk to you. Anuli's helped us, and he wants off this trash heap. I don't blame him.
Well, she misspoke. It happens.
She was wrong.
Anuli's helped us out a lot. He just wants a better life off this sleazy moon. I don't blame him.
All we'd have to do is drop him off at the next spaceport. Please? I owe it to him.
I hate it here. Everyone uses me. Insults me. I'm just garbage. I hate being scared all the time.
I'll do it for Mako.
All right.
Aww, thanks! This means a lot to me! I'll owe you one!
Don't you work for Gele'ren?
What about your boss?
What do I care? I'll be running my own clan soon. He'll be back. They always come back.
Perfect! So it's settled? He can come with us?
Sure. There's room on the ship.
Absolutely.
Oh, thank you! This means so much to me! I owe you a really big favor!
We're dropping him off first thing.
Just for a ride.
No problem! I'm sure he'll do fine. Thanks so much for this! I owe you one.
He creeps me out.
No.
I'll help the hunter. I'll do whatever I have to.
You better get used to it, worm.
You deserve it.
What? But he's helped us! Dropping him off at a spaceport costs you nothing!
This conversation's over.
I said no.
Fine, if it means that much to you.
Fine, fine.
Thank you! It does! I won't forget this! And I'll make it up to you! I promise!
Never question my decision again.
Stop talking, Mako.
Fine! I'll try not to bother you next time!
Ha! You have a promising career in the Cartel if you ever give up bounty hunting.
Now that's settled, let's get back to the job of driving Eidolon Security outta business.
Go take care of business. Not sure what you got against Ugnaughts, but knock yourself out!
The hunter's gotta know. Gele'ren should talk about it. Mako said it was important. She said so.
Wait! What did you find, Anuli?
Aw, for the love of franging credits! We're discussing business here!
Strange weapon orders. Armor plating, blaster cannons, defense shields. Shipped to an abandoned warehouse in the Duros Sector. Makes no sense.
Armor plating? Hang on, that sounds really familiar. Let me check something....
Talk to me, Mako.
We have a lead on someone?
This sounds like bad news.
I'm guessing it's not good?
Hey, remember me, your boss?
Don't ignore me, Mako.
I was gonna tell you. And you're not my boss. But anyway....
I asked Anuli to help me watch for possible bounty hunter rivals and to look out for anything weird.
And this is. Even for Nar Shaddaa. Nobody ships expensive hardware to empty buildings. Or if they do, they hide it better.
Here it is! The Zargnor Clan! I knew those weapon parts sounded familiar!
A clan of Ugnaughts got into the Great Hunt by building a bizarre war droid that they would ride inside of.
The thing's blaster cannons blew up during the grand melee. Everyone was killed except the Ugnaughts inside the armored droid, making them the winners.
I'm surprised an entire clan counts as one hunter.
So we've found my rival.
Maybe they count by weight.
Wish I'd seen that.
Sounds amusing at least.
Worth the price of admission, that's for sure.
Please say this is a joke.
You're kidding.
Hey, as possible rival bounty hunters go, these might not be too bad. Assuming they haven't finished their new war droid.
But... it'd probably be a good idea to get them before they finish.
Where are they again?
Tell me where.
Let's kill something.
You're assuming they haven't blown themselves up.
Maybe we'll get lucky.
Hey, maybe they already have! You never know.
The warehouse they shipped the parts to is in a really sketchy part of town. It'll be tough to get to.
Look, eh, I don't know what this is about, and I don't think I wanna know.
Take care of your personal business, and when you get back, we'll chat more about the Eidolon.
Did you feel it? Ha! The Eidolon's property will rain down on the streets for days!
I can already hear his holoconversation with the Republic:
"Were those our billions of credits going up in smoke?"
Let's get back to business.
Moving on.
Right! Right! We still got a job to do. All right, Eidolon Security ain't down for the count yet.
Maybe the Eidolon will ask you for a loan.
I'm sure this humbled him.
Ha! Yeah. I'd give my left lekku to see that gank beg me for credits.
We'll bleed them dry.
They'll be hurting.
And savor every franging drop! Ha! I love this business!
I got some discretionary funds from the Cartel to deal with these sorts of problems. I think you've earned more than a few.
I'll be watching the sky for that huge fireball. Can't wait. Ha!
The Eidolon's biggest client is the Republic. Eidolon Security supplies those ganks with billions of credits worth of munitions every year.
Is Eidolon Security actually allied with the Republic?
He's with the Republic?
It's a business! It allies with the biggest bank account. And the Republic's got a pretty impressive one.
Billion credits worth of munitions would blow up a whole lot of marks.
That's more than even I use.
That's a potentially dangerous client he has.
Republic could get in the way.
Ain't that the truth! Self-righteous pains in the rear.
Eidolon Security's got a stockpile of munitions bound for the Republic Army. Crates are at their manufacturing facility in the Corellian Sector.
If that facility were to blow up, the Eidolon would owe the Republic billions of credits--which I'm guessing he ain't got just lying around.
Can't use thermal detonators. Too small. Need baradium charges. Like the ones Brel made. Before he blew up.
Hang on, hang on. Wha--hey you're hearing that outta context. Brel blew himself up because he got cocky.
These baradium charges are perfectly safe. You got my word!
Fine, hand them over.
Then let's do this.
Always wanted to go out with a bang.
What the heck.
That's the spirit! Ha! I wish I had a dozen of you working for me... er... with me.
I've seen how much that's worth.
I don't trust that.
Hey, that hurts. What would I gain if you blew yourself up? I need you, buddy!
The charges are magnetic. Gotta put them on the power generators for maximum yield. One in the control center, too.
A facility that size will have several generators. It's pretty standard. They'll be easy to spot.
The charges are on a synchronized timer. After you've planted the last one in the control room, set the timer. Then get outta there.
I'm sick of excuses! I'll feed all you worthless slugs to a rancor if I have to! You hear what--
Excuse me? Hey, nobody just walks in here, huh. Nobody!
I'm a bounty hunter. Hunting the Eidolon. Interested?
The Eidolon? What, you're kidding me, right? No... tell me you're kidding! You're... you're not kidding.
All right, I'll bite. Boys, get out of here and get us some refreshments.
The Eidolon did some work for us, you know. He could kill anybody, anywhere. This guy was unbelievable.
Does he have a real name?
Who is this guy?
Never met him in person. When you do that, you die. The Cartel always communicated with him via holo.
I can understand why you liked him.
You admired him.
Oh, those were the good days, let me tell ya! We had plenty of work for him.
Killing folks ain't that hard.
So am I.
Anyone can kill a gank on the street, but the Eidolon specialized in impossible targets.
But then, at the top of his game, the Eidolon announces he's getting out of the assassination business. Opened a security company.
Suddenly, half the corporations here were clients of Eidolon Security--and were no longer paying the Hutt Cartel.
Hey, Gele'ren, I haven't finished slicing those casino lugjack machines, but I thought that....
Anuli?
That's Mako! Everyone said she was dead! The Rodian brothers grabbed her!
Someone saved me from those antenna heads, Anuli. A good friend. He took me away to Hutta.
We're trying to work here.
Business first, Mako.
Hey, I haven't seen Anuli in years. We grew up together--sorry, I'll shut up now.
Is your old flame going to be a problem?
An old boyfriend?
What? No! It's not like that. He's like my little brother.
We're in the middle of something.
Everybody shut up.
Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt business. We'll catch up later.
You two know each other?
Old friend?
Anuli and I grew up together on the streets. He's like my little brother.
Can we get back to business? Yes?
Forget the lugjack scam--our problems with the Eidolon may be over. Meet our solution!
Is it a hunter? Looks like a hunter. One hunter can't take on the Eidolon. Eidolon kills everybody.
What's wrong with him?
Is he dumb?
Typical spice rat. Fried a few too many circuits. But he's a damn good slicer and an even better fence.
You're about to get a new hero, kid.
He won't kill me.
The Eidolon's a shadow--knows everything. You never see him coming.
Are you talking to me?
Excuse me?
Don't mind him. He just fried a few too many circuits. Too much spice. But he's a damn good slicer and an even better fence.
Look, nobody knows how to find the Eidolon. But if you hurt his company, he'll find you. I've seen it before.
Keep it down, you little worm! Can't you see we're talking business!
Mako said what was important?
What's up?
He's been catching up with your little friend, is all. Told him he should be concentrating on business!
You holding out on me, Gele'ren?
Keeping secrets, gangster?
Not at all! What--yea--just been kinda busy, ya know?
You should keep your help in line.
Why is he talking again?
If he weren't so blasted useful, I'd melt his face off right here.
Go ahead, Anuli. Get it off your miserable little chest. We'll talk about protocol later.
The hunter should talk to Mako. Mako will know more. I'll call her.
Got your signal, Anuli. You're right, this is pretty weird. Armor plating? That sounds familiar. Let me check something....
